intro: Hibbertia fasciculata var. clavata, commonly known as the clustered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows in heathland and woodland areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in clusters, giving it its common name. Hibbertia fasciculata var. clavata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
